AS OF DAT E See BLK 1 6 13. DATE OF SUBSEQUENT SUBMISSIO N See BLK 1 6 b. COPIE S 16. REMARK S Block 4: Prepare the required document, in contractor format, in accordance with the cited DID. a. ADDRESSE E DRAF T FINA L Reg Repr o The Contractor shall prepare a Core (whole AFATDS system) and Supplemental SSDD (design threads). The Contractor shall prepare the SSDD such that it is partitioned according to the SSS products. The SSDD shall reflect the allocation of requirements to the physical processes t hat comprise the software and full bi -directional traceability. Relationship between the physical processes and logical components shall also be reflected . Block 9: Distribution D: Distribution authorized to the DoD and U.S. DoD contractors only; furt her distribution at the direction of Project Manager, Mission Command, SFAE-CCC -MC . Block 10, 11, 12 & 13: The Contractor shall deliver a draft version no later than 20 calendar days prior to Test for Record (TFR). The Contractor shall deliver a final version in conjunction with software Final Release . The Government shall review and provide comments within 30 calendar days of receipt of the document. The final reproduced version is due back to the Government within 30 calendar days following the r eceipt of comments . Block 14: Submissions for PM MC shall be posted to DI2E and IDE with email notification to the Contracting Officer’s Representative. PM M C 0 2

ADDRESSE E DRAF T FINA L Reg Repr o The Contractor shall prepare for the totality of the AFATDS. The SVD shall clearly delineate the information as pertaining to each component for which a SSS is prepared. Block 9: Distribution D: Distribution authorized to the Department of Defense a nd U.S. DoD contractors only; further distribution at the direction of Project Manager, Mission Command, SFA E-CCC-MC . Block 10, 11, 12 & 13: A SVD will be submitted each time software is delivered to the Government (this applies both for engineering releases and final releases of software). As part of the SVD the Contractor shall prepare Release Notes. SVD and Release notes will be made available at the same time that software is delivered to the Government. The Government shall review and provide

comments within 30 calendar days of receipt of the document. The final reproduced version is due back to the Government within 30 calend ar days following the receipt of comments .
